title: Make a Custom Bluetooth Mechanical Keyboard Gamepad
text:
Go to permalink 
We’ve seen plenty of custom controllers over the years , but for those who prefer the tactile feel of a keyboard, Adafruit has put together a guide to make your own little keyboard-gamepad. Build Your Own Portable Arcade Stick with a Raspberry Pi-Powered Console Packed Inside Build Your Own Portable Arcade Stick with a Raspberry Pi-Powered Console Packed Inside Build Your Own Portable Arcade Stick with a… The Raspberry Pi is easily the best way to make your own little retro game console, but Hacker… Read more Read more 
The idea here is to use a set of Cherry MX mechanical keyboard switches to make a small, handheld keyboard controller that still feels pretty good. You’ll need to get a few parts 3D printed , solder together a few connections, and create a custom circuit board, but the end result is a fully customizable miniature keyboard that will likely have tons of different uses. Head over to Adafruit for the full guide. Advertisement
